result.rationale: This species endemic to the Nassau Mountains in Suriname. It has a restricted distribution with an extent of occurrence (EOO) of 702 km<sup>2</sup> and an area of occupancy (AOO) of 364 km<sup>2</sup>. There are two locations based on the threat of mining. This threat is leading to a continuing decline in habitat. Therefore, this species is assessed as EN B1ab(iii).
result.geographicrange: This species is endemic to the Nassau Mountains in Suriname.
result.population: No population assessments are known for this species.
result.habitat: According to Covain et al. (2012): "Geijskens and Creutzberg described the habitat of Harttiella crassicauda as a small forest creek on top of nas-sau Mountains, with a rocky bottom covered with sand and stones, and some falls."
result.threats: Harttiella crassicauda is restricted to the Nassau mountains in Suriname. This region is under concession to mining activities (Mol 2009), and the species has sometimes been considered as severely threatened or even extinct (Mol and Ouboter 2004, Covain et al. 2012).
result.conservationmeasures: No specific conservation actions are known for this species.
result.usetrade: There is no use or trade information for this species.
